title: 10.1 Stacks and Queues
content:
Section 10.1

Stacks and Queues

Summary

Basic data structures with restricted access patterns.

Key Points

  • Stack: LIFO (Last-In-First-Out) - PUSH and POP
  • Queue: FIFO (First-In-First-Out) - ENQUEUE and DEQUEUE
  • Both can be implemented with arrays or linked lists
  • All operations O(1)
  • Stack: function calls, undo, parsing. Queue: BFS, scheduling

Pseudocode

PUSH(S, x):
    S.top = S.top + 1
    S[S.top] = x

POP(S):
    if S.top == 0: error "underflow"
    S.top = S.top - 1
    return S[S.top + 1]

Example

Stack for expression evaluation: push operands, pop two when operator seen, push result.

Why It Matters

Fundamental building blocks used in countless algorithms.
